It is characterized by its large, broad leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant belongs to the Melioschinzia genus, which is part of the Polygonaceae family, known for its unique floral structures. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
